DataElement.preferredName: Foot Dorsiflexion Passive Range of Motion Symptom Severity Testing Result 4 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric rating of the severity of a patient's foot dorsiflexion symptoms evaluated through Passive Range of Motion (PROM) exercises.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Foot Passive Range of Motion Symptom Severity Testing Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The structure found below the ankle joint required for locomotion._Any of the digits of the hand._A measure of how far a joint can move when it is being manipulated by someone other than the patient._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._A procedure for critical evaluation._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The terminal part of the lower extremity, especially the part below the ankle.:A measure of how far a joint can move when it is being manipulated by someone other than the patient.

Concepts.definition: The structure found below the ankle joint.
A measure of how far a joint can move when it is being manipulated by someone other than the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A procedure for critical evaluation.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Severity 4 Point Likert Scale Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree.: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 2 on a Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 2 on a Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 3 on a Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 3 on a Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of non-agreement.: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.

A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
